newsitem.title: USA: System Software named in class action.
newsitem.headline: System Software named in class action.

text.p: Attorneys representing certain shareholders of System Software Associations Inc said Friday they have filed a class action suit against the company.
Attorneys with the firm of Cohen Milstein Hausfeld & Toll PLLC said the suit covers those who bought the company stock from September 15, 1994 through January 7, 1997.
The suit was filed in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois.
The suit alleges that the company put out incorrect financial and business information and that its revenues were improperly reported, a release from the attorneys said.
System Software did not immediately return a phone call seeking comment.
Earlier this month the Chicago-based company said it would restate its fiscal 1995 and 1994 results to reflect the reversal of revenues involving several million dollars.
Those named in the suit include the company's chief executive, a former chief executive and the company's chief financial officer, the attorneys' release said.
System Software shares fell 1/4 Friday to 11-1/4.
